channel.title: Need help robot ideas
channel.description: My robotics FRC team needs ideas on how we can pickup a frisbee with a robot The. Frisbee being flat on the ground And being able to pick it up and being able to throw it back from where the frisbee came from

item.title: Need help robot ideas
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

Thank You, I am not good with my hands, like I wouldn’t individually know what to put for each part because I am not used to engineering but I will try my best on building
Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Need help robot ideas
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:4, topic:477888”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=596087.msg4196967#msg4196967 date=1357631219]
Slide something flat underneath the frisbee like a spatula.
[/quote]
Put a hydraulic onto the finger to move them both out of the way. It will need to be fast, but it could work.

I was going to suggest something like that. But instead of just being flat why not have the robot use it like a finger. You would have a slightly raised end that would be at a 90 degree angle and then have the robot put that edge under the Frisbee and then move it back to horizontal, then you would have another say finger that would put pressure on the top to hold it in place. You can then have that same arm throw the Frisbee, but some complications may arise on the throwing part because of the raised edge…[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Need help robot ideas
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Slide something flat underneath the frisbee like a spatula.

I was going to suggest something like that. But instead of just being flat why not have the robot use it like a finger. You would have a slightly raised end that would be at a 90 degree angle and then have the robot put that edge under the Frisbee and then move it back to horizontal, then you would have another say finger that would put pressure on the top to hold it in place. You can then have that same arm throw the Frisbee, but some complications may arise on the throwing part because of the raised edge…

Try a vacuum suction cup you could use to drop it onto a throwing arm. Not sure if its the most efficient but it would work.
